reviews.title: New UI is bad
reviews.body: I’m giving 1* for the UI changes (not for Xcode as a whole). With the old UI I could choose to have the side panels hidden on some window tabs, and shown on other window tabs—that convenience is now gone: either shown or hidden on ALL window tabs. That is not logical, because the navigator belongs to the window tab (the selection within the navigator is tied to the window tab), therefore its visibility should also be determined by the window tab. Furthermore, as someone else reviewed, the UI for the left side panel (the navigators) is hideous; and it is also confusing: the buttons at the top of the left side panel are visually within the side panel, but they stay in place (almost) when the side panel is closed. Even worse, given the visual cues of the views, you’d think that the red close button should close only the side panel, but it closes the entire window.
reviews.body_cleaned: I’m giving 1* for the UI changes (not for Xcode as a whole). With the old UI I could choose to have the side panels hidden on some window tabs, and shown on other window tabs—that convenience is now gone: either shown or hidden on ALL window tabs. That is not logical, because the navigator belongs to the window tab (the selection within the navigator is tied to the window tab), therefore its visibility should also be determined by the window tab. Furthermore, as someone else reviewed, the UI for the left side panel (the navigators) is hideous; and it is also confusing: the buttons at the top of the left side panel are visually within the side panel, but they stay in place (almost) when the side panel is closed. Even worse, given the visual cues of the views, you’d think that the red close button should close only the side panel, but it closes the entire window.

reviews.title: Horrible IDE with the exception of Interface Builder
reviews.body:
UPDATE: 
10 years later and it is still the worst development environment ever and now with the addition of development on the Apple Watch, it is a nightmare. I continue to say that Apple engineers should be embarrassed that they produce such horrible development environment that is stupidly fragile.

ORIGINAL POST:
XCode always has been, and always will be an embarassment to Apple. What is probably the most embarassing is that AppCode by JetBrains, which is only a few years old, is many orders of magnitude better. Run, do not walk to AppCode.

With all this said, I do very much love Interface Builder, which is why I gave it two stars instead of none.
reviews.body_cleaned: UPDATE: 10 years later and it is still the worst development environment ever and now with the addition of development on the Apple Watch, it is a nightmare. I continue to say that Apple engineers should be embarrassed that they produce such horrible development environment that is stupidly fragile. ORIGINAL POST: XCode always has been, and always will be an embarassment to Apple. What is probably the most embarassing is that AppCode by JetBrains, which is only a few years old, is many orders of magnitude better. Run, do not walk to AppCode. With all this said, I do very much love Interface Builder, which is why I gave it two stars instead of none.

reviews.title: IDE
reviews.body:
Integrated with what?

Go ahead and change the name of the project, I dare you. Change the name of the folder that the “.xcodeproj” is in. Change the name of the “.xcodeproj”. Then be a good little boy/girl and help Xcode by opening the project file and changing the name of the project folder similarly there.  Congratulations you have just broken your project!  Integrated.. yea sure, not with the macOS file system.

This is a file browser and not a source code editor. It cannot maintain a document/file editing capability like BBEdit, the windows constantly change context and unless you just use one window (aka MS Windows mode) you are constantly lost.  Isn’t that massive screen you use so useful now for just 1 editor window?

Now for the gotcha, it screws up being a browser too! It violates the basic constructs of windows, tabs, and changing window/tab context that Safari has established.

So many basic problems with this massive (bloated) application at the very basic levels yet every release shows all of these features I never asked for or really need.  

RedRyder Featureitus.

People’s careers and livelihoods depend on this software. We need a SnowXcode. PLEASE FIX THE BASICS. (yes, we have submitted bug reports and you ignore them)
reviews.body_cleaned: Integrated with what? Go ahead and change the name of the project, I dare you. Change the name of the folder that the “.xcodeproj” is in. Change the name of the “.xcodeproj”. Then be a good little boy/girl and help Xcode by opening the project file and changing the name of the project folder similarly there. Congratulations you have just broken your project! Integrated.. yea sure, not with the macOS file system. This is a file browser and not a source code editor. It cannot maintain a document/file editing capability like BBEdit, the windows constantly change context and unless you just use one window (aka MS Windows mode) you are constantly lost. Isn’t that massive screen you use so useful now for just 1 editor window? Now for the gotcha, it screws up being a browser too! It violates the basic constructs of windows, tabs, and changing window/tab context that Safari has established. So many basic problems with this massive (bloated) application at the very basic levels yet every release shows all of these features I never asked for or really need. RedRyder Featureitus. People’s careers and livelihoods depend on this software. We need a SnowXcode. PLEASE FIX THE BASICS. (yes, we have submitted bug reports and you ignore them)

reviews.title: Xcode 26 is the worst of all
reviews.body:
Xcode 26 is the worst ever update in years. It’s incredibly buggy and slow. It gets stuck on trivial things indefinitely. I have to constantly do all that nonsense that no developer should have to spend their precious time on - reboot, restart, delete derived data, restart simulator, etc…, etc…. End even after all that it still just gets stuck for several minutes while loading the app to the simulator.
Super frustrating.
reviews.body_cleaned: Xcode 26 is the worst ever update in years. It’s incredibly buggy and slow. It gets stuck on trivial things indefinitely. I have to constantly do all that nonsense that no developer should have to spend their precious time on - reboot, restart, delete derived data, restart simulator, etc…, etc…. End even after all that it still just gets stuck for several minutes while loading the app to the simulator. Super frustrating.

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.body: I needed to install the “metal” compiler so I could run an open source application that uses the Apple Neural Engine (ANE). Apparently the only way to get access to the “metal” compiler is to install the ENTIRE XCode suite of software. I don’t use XCode for anything else, and it’s a massive download, wasting tons of disk space, and it takes a long time to download. This is extremely wasteful, just to get access to one small component.
reviews.body_cleaned: I needed to install the “metal” compiler so I could run an open source application that uses the Apple Neural Engine (ANE). Apparently the only way to get access to the “metal” compiler is to install the ENTIRE XCode suite of software. This is extremely wasteful, just to get access to one small component.

reviews.title: ChatGPT still rate limited for paid subscribers
reviews.body:
ChatGPT is still being rate limited in Xcode for paid subscribers with no explanation of the rate limits anywhere at all. If it is in the middle of making changes to your files when the rate limit is hit, you’re left with a mess of half implemented changes. 
Terrible experience.
reviews.body_cleaned: ChatGPT is still being rate limited in Xcode for paid subscribers with no explanation of the rate limits anywhere at all. If it is in the middle of making changes to your files when the rate limit is hit, you’re left with a mess of half implemented changes. Terrible experience.

Our new iPhones were forced to update to 26.1 and now in Xcode we cannot access the iOS package required to work with these devices. 

Some of us are testing and running schemes on medical applications and cannot afford mishaps like this. Estimated time to fix?

26.1 doesn't work, heavier, it is total disaster.

reviews.title: Everything breaks for no reason.
reviews.body: I really liked how everything worked yesterday, then I, didn’t update anything. Now I go to Starbucks, get a coffee, ready to work, and all of a sudden I need to update my device and download 10gb. Great devEx. Starbucks throttles your internet when you download a ton of stuff, so either I go home, or download it on mobile data. I wanted to sit down, have a bit of fun adding a new feature, and instead, a bunch of time on the least fun part of development.

Now I go to Starbucks, get a coffee, ready to work, and all of a sudden I need to update my device and download 10gb. Great devEx. Starbucks throttles your internet when you download a ton of stuff, so either I go home, or download it on mobile data. I wanted to sit down, have a bit of fun adding a new feature, and instead, a bunch of time on the least fun part of development.

reviews.title: Horrible AI integration
reviews.body: ChatGPT cant remember any context from session to session. It cant see files in your projects folder and often believes it makes files when they arent actually there. It cant change target memberships, most of the time it doesnt even read your project settings correctly... It’s basically useless. I’m of a very strong opinion it needs to be completely removed until a develop has the time to actually build it properly.

It cant change target memberships, most of the time it doesnt even read your project settings correctly... It’s basically useless. I’m of a very strong opinion it needs to be completely removed until a develop has the time to actually build it properly.

reviews.title: Horrible window management update
reviews.body: Why is window and tab management so absolutely rigid and terrible in the new liquid glass update? It is painful. Seriously can someone at apple take a page out of VSCodes book on window and tab management? Why is there no tab bar out of the box? Why is it hidden?! Once im able to figure out how to open a tab, why can we hardly move it around! All I want to do is open a new tab and drag it to a new different window or open a window if im dragging it somewhere new. When I do create a new window I don’t need every tab I had open in the previous window to be duplicated to the new window. Im opening a new window in order to put something else in it. Can someone at apple recruiting send me an email with a job offer so I can come in and fix this?
reviews.body_cleaned: Why is window and tab management so absolutely rigid and terrible in the new liquid glass update? It is painful. Seriously can someone at apple take a page out of VSCodes book on window and tab management? Why is there no tab bar out of the box? Why is it hidden?! Once im able to figure out how to open a tab, why can we hardly move it around! All I want to do is open a new tab and drag it to a new different window or open a window if im dragging it somewhere new. When I do create a new window I don’t need every tab I had open in the previous window to be duplicated to the new window. Im opening a new window in order to put something else in it. Can someone at apple recruiting send me an email with a job offer so I can come in and fix this?

But as time passed as soon as I updated it to the latest version, everything started getting broken, workspace files does not work anymore. I even tried to regenerate workspace files but same. Also tried to downgrade; still same with simulators and workspace files. Really flawed. I always believed that apple make great products, did not expect this. Lot of issues with it

reviews.title: Xcode really fell off
reviews.body: The ai features are nice, but the restrictions apple has added to development such as removing wireless JIT are just annoying. Additionally, the releases of Xcode for the new macOS versions are significantly delayed compared to the release date of these operating systems, which should really be released at the same time.
reviews.body_cleaned: The ai features are nice, but the restrictions apple has added to development such as removing wireless JIT are just annoying. Additionally, the releases of Xcode for the new macOS versions are significantly delayed compared to the release date of these operating systems, which should really be released at the same time.

reviews.title: Xcode needs come work… but MacOS 26 is coming.
reviews.body: Xcode needs some work. It appears that Xcode for MacOS 26 is going to have some advancements. I’ll be excited to try them out. Compare the JetBrains IDEs, Xcode seems dated. While I enjoy working in Xcode much more than Visual Studio, it’s clear that AI has become such a useful tool for developers to help catch bugs, and troubleshoot issues. I will love to use Xcode, but I hope that the forthcoming enhancements are as impactful as though need to be.
reviews.body_cleaned: Xcode needs some work. It appears that Xcode for MacOS 26 is going to have some advancements. I’ll be excited to try them out. Compare the JetBrains IDEs, Xcode seems dated. While I enjoy working in Xcode much more than Visual Studio, it’s clear that AI has become such a useful tool for developers to help catch bugs, and troubleshoot issues. I will love to use Xcode, but I hope that the forthcoming enhancements are as impactful as though need to be.

reviews.title: Awful
reviews.body: Nope.
reviews.body_cleaned: Nope.

reviews.title: Hello 2000
reviews.body: Dear Apple, If your goal is to limit new development in the ecosystem, you have SUCCEEDED. Simple setup and testing of an app idea is a nightmare. XCODE is not preAI it is Microsoft Windows level UI and complexity of the 2000s.
reviews.body_cleaned: Dear Apple, If your goal is to limit new development in the ecosystem, you have SUCCEEDED. Simple setup and testing of an app idea is a nightmare. XCODE is not preAI it is Microsoft Windows level UI and complexity of the 2000s.

reviews.title: The only one to use
reviews.body: I have been using this and it is the one to get the job done. It does GIT and backups and test Flights. For developing the MacOS and all this is the best app for the job. I love it. And if there are hangups with it, using ChatGPT, there are workarounds at your fingertips, errrr uh….voice command.

I love it. And if there are hangups with it, using ChatGPT, there are workarounds at your fingertips, errrr uh….voice command.

reviews.title: It’s getting worse each year
reviews.body: It’s getting worse each year. Guys don’t add new features. Just make it stable. Also having a built-in web debugging proxy (like Proxyman or Charles) so we don’t need to suffer and play around with certificates on simulators and real devices. Additionally, could you also please make Instruments more user friendly? I’d suggest to take a look what Emerge tools did and adopt the same idea in Xcode. All their data is user friendly and easy to use to determine what’s going on in the app. It’s sad to see that some other companies have more “Apple” user experience than Apple itself.
reviews.body_cleaned: It’s getting worse each year. Guys don’t add new features. Just make it stable. Also having a built-in web debugging proxy (like Proxyman or Charles) so we don’t need to suffer and play around with certificates on simulators and real devices. Additionally, could you also please make Instruments more user friendly? I’d suggest to take a look what Emerge tools did and adopt the same idea in Xcode. All their data is user friendly and easy to use to determine what’s going on in the app. It’s sad to see that some other companies have more “Apple” user experience than Apple itself.

reviews.title: Most frustrating restrictive piece garbage I’ve ever had the displeasure of being forced to use
reviews.body:
Xcode is way too entrenched in the developer experience on Mac

AppleID is required to download Xcode

Phone number is required to create an AppleID

I don’t want my privacy probed just because I want certain CLI tools to work on my MacBook

Horrendous experience
reviews.body_cleaned: Xcode is way too entrenched in the developer experience on Mac AppleID is required to download Xcode Phone number is required to create an AppleID I don’t want my privacy probed just because I want certain CLI tools to work on my MacBook Horrendous experience

reviews.title: Where are the AI agents?
reviews.body: Xcode is so slow. Waiting for minutes for preview to appear.  And no AI agent plugins? When I switch to Android Studio or Jetbrains Rider the experience is just significantly better but Apple has monopoly and no other option besides Xcode. I use vscode with iOS project so I can use AI agents, but then have to switch back to Xcode to preview and run.

When I switch to Android Studio or Jetbrains Rider the experience is just significantly better but Apple has monopoly and no other option besides Xcode. I use vscode with iOS project so I can use AI agents, but then have to switch back to Xcode to preview and run.

reviews.title: Utter Garbage
reviews.body: The most fragile IDE I’ve ever had the displeasure of *attempting* to use. Can’t stay out of its own way, breaks ALL the time. Amazing Apple hasn’t realized 90% of their cross-platform apps are developed using ANDROID emulators before being ported over.

reviews.title: It crashes too many times

reviews.title: Terrible and getting worse
reviews.body: Apple should hire Microsoft to make their development tools. This would eliminate bug and make the product delightful to use.
reviews.body_cleaned: Apple should hire Microsoft to make their development tools. This would eliminate bug and make the product delightful to use.

reviews.title: Unstable and buggy
reviews.body: Xcode crashes many times a day for me.  Code completion has become almost useless.  The suggestions are hardly ever correct for complex scenarios and for simple scenarios where it should be able to fill in the most obvious function or property name, it gets it wrong a lot of the time.  It ignores settings, like “Automatically reformat when completing code”.  Even with it turned off, it still reformats my code on me when I accept the rare code completion suggestion that it got right.
reviews.body_cleaned: Xcode crashes many times a day for me. Code completion has become almost useless. The suggestions are hardly ever correct for complex scenarios and for simple scenarios where it should be able to fill in the most obvious function or property name, it gets it wrong a lot of the time. It ignores settings, like “Automatically reformat when completing code”. Even with it turned off, it still reformats my code on me when I accept the rare code completion suggestion that it got right.

reviews.title: Underrated
reviews.body: One of the best developer tools that should be five starts. You can’t compare this to Jetbrains or other IDE’s because Xcode does so much for developing on the Apple platform that is under appreciated. Keep up the great work Xcode team!

reviews.title: A terrible IDE

reviews.title: Amazing UI, but functionality is lacking — needs to be ‘hard reset’ extremely often
reviews.body: The whole system relating to derived data / packages / dependency graph just seems extremely brittle. I change branches, or even just change a name of a file? I get some vague error and have to wait 0.5-2 hours to clear derived data and/or packages for Xcode to be functional again
reviews.body_cleaned: The whole system relating to derived data / packages / dependency graph just seems extremely brittle. I change branches, or even just change a name of a file? I get some vague error and have to wait 0.5-2 hours to clear derived data and/or packages for Xcode to be functional again

reviews.title: Son Vu
reviews.body: Xcode is a great tool and worth every penny.  The documentation is great.  I love the ability to integrate with GitHub and Xcode Cloud since it makes it very convenient to built and submit my apps.  For a newbie, the app approval process might be too tedious and overwhelming though.

I love the ability to integrate with GitHub and Xcode Cloud since it makes it very convenient to built and submit my apps. For a newbie, the app approval process might be too tedious and overwhelming though.

reviews.title: Sufficient error diagnostics pinpoint!
reviews.body: If my app is crashing when ran from Xcode, I expect a dictionary pinpointing to the exact fault! Broad compiler errors and memory bad acces   that aren’t explicitly describing the bad access are useless and ambiguous to development!

reviews.title: An Utter Catastrophe
reviews.body: I’m blown away but what a disaster this IDE is. It crashes constantly. It’s ridiculously slow. It doesn’t do even basic IDE functionality. It’s utterly terrible.

reviews.title: A total disgrace
reviews.body: Xcode is utterly a disgrace for Apple. The only differences between releases are Swift compiler updates (provided by swift.org) and new simulator binaries. Everything else is abandoned with annoying bugs not fixed for years.

reviews.title: Terrible IDE
reviews.body: The amount of bugs and non-compatibility across versions is not worth using a separate IDE for swift development. This application, not the language Swift itself, is the reason I stopped learning swift. It is much more worth your time to just use VSCode and learn something else.

This application, not the language Swift itself, is the reason I stopped learning swift. It is much more worth your time to just use VSCode and learn something else.

reviews.title: It does the job
reviews.body: No IDe is perfect, but in over 30 years of programming I find that Xcode does a well balanced job of exposing new features, and keeping me productive.

reviews.title: Can you add a Swift Linter?
reviews.body:
Would be great if we had a built-in "Linter" for Swift code that makes sure all Swift code is formatted in the same way across our projects.

Also don’t block us for device operations like “copying symbols”. It’s insanely annoying that the entire editor is blocked when these operations are running.
reviews.body_cleaned: Would be great if we had a built-in "Linter" for Swift code that makes sure all Swift code is formatted in the same way across our projects. Also don’t block us for device operations like “copying symbols”. It’s insanely annoying that the entire editor is blocked when these operations are running.

reviews.title: Redoing work due to crashes
reviews.body: Pretty sad this is where we are - a simple framework project can crash and take completed work with it.
reviews.body_cleaned: Pretty sad this is where we are - a simple framework project can crash and take completed work with it.

reviews.title: Xcode is unusable for React Native development on macOS Sequoia
reviews.body: I'm on a brand new Mac running macOS Sequoia, and Apple forces me to use Xcode 15.4, which is incompatible with every stable version of React Native under Expo SDK 50. Downgrading Xcode isn’t allowed, and older Xcode versions won't even open. The latest Xcode breaks native builds due to C++ standard library issues (std::char_traits<unsigned char> in RCT-Folly). No workarounds work without major hacks, patching, or virtual machines.
reviews.body_cleaned: I'm on a brand new Mac running macOS Sequoia, and Apple forces me to use Xcode 15.4, which is incompatible with every stable version of React Native under Expo SDK 50. Downgrading Xcode isn’t allowed, and older Xcode versions won't even open. The latest Xcode breaks native builds due to C++ standard library issues (std::char_traits<unsigned char> in RCT-Folly). No workarounds work without major hacks, patching, or virtual machines.

reviews.title: If my review ever gets noticed.
reviews.body: I have two minor issues that we run into daily and I am sure Xcode team can fix it. 1. The SwiftUI canvas always gets reset to split half half even if we switch tabs. Please allow users to pick split ratios. The canvas taking 1/4 of screen is ideal. 2. "The compiler is unable to type-check this expression”. This is driving new developers like me crazy. This error does not pin point the line of code that has the error. Please fix. Please fix. Please fix.
reviews.body_cleaned: I have two minor issues that we run into daily and I am sure Xcode team can fix it. 1. The SwiftUI canvas always gets reset to split half half even if we switch tabs. Please allow users to pick split ratios. The canvas taking 1/4 of screen is ideal. 2. "The compiler is unable to type-check this expression”. This is driving new developers like me crazy. This error does not pin point the line of code that has the error. Please fix. Please fix. Please fix.

reviews.title: Apple does not care about developers
reviews.body: It is amazing that with every rollout you break customers. It is amazing that you enforce supporting new iOS versions, but for new versions, you need the latest Xcode, but for the latest Xcode, you need the latest OS, and after 3-4 years, for the latest OS, you need a new Mac. Shameful
reviews.body_cleaned: It is amazing that with every rollout you break customers. It is amazing that you enforce supporting new iOS versions, but for new versions, you need the latest Xcode, but for the latest Xcode, you need the latest OS, and after 3-4 years, for the latest OS, you need a new Mac. Shameful

reviews.title: Developers’ nightmare IDE ever
reviews.body:
If you have used an IDE like visual studio or android studio you’d hate how slow Xcode is. Apple keeps adding unnecessary features to it but the basic functionality is still broken despite being in the market for 16+ years. The types don’t load properly, I cant cmd+click a type and read the documentation. 

Working with playgrounds is even worse. You write 1000+ lines of utility functions and it takes ages to run. It’s a test of patience to use playground. 

Sincere request to Apple - Please spend some money on making Xcode team to make this IDE better. If you’re doing that already, please bring in some accountability to that team. As a tenured iOS dev, I feel the IDE hasn’t gotten better at all.
reviews.body_cleaned: If you have used an IDE like visual studio or android studio you’d hate how slow Xcode is. Apple keeps adding unnecessary features to it but the basic functionality is still broken despite being in the market for 16+ years. The types don’t load properly, I cant cmd+click a type and read the documentation. Working with playgrounds is even worse. You write 1000+ lines of utility functions and it takes ages to run. It’s a test of patience to use playground. Sincere request to Apple - Please spend some money on making Xcode team to make this IDE better. If you’re doing that already, please bring in some accountability to that team. As a tenured iOS dev, I feel the IDE hasn’t gotten better at all.
